title: Guidelines for 'nurdle' transportation agreed after X-Press Pearl disaster - TradeWinds
summary: New stowage recommendations for plastic pellets, known as nurdles, have been agreed upon following the X-Press Pearl container ship disaster off Sri Lanka in 2021. Nurdles are small plastic pellets used to create plastic products and are harmful to marine life as they can be mistaken for food and break down into microplastics. The disaster involved the grounding and fire of the X-Press Pearl, highlighting the need for safer handling of these materials.

title: European Commission refuses to let the dust settle on the EU Taxonomy - Travers Smith
summary: The European Union's Taxonomy for Sustainable Activities is being amended to include activities related to the transition to sustainable transport. This includes activities like manufacturing components for low-carbon transport and upgrading existing aircraft to reduce their emissions. While some argue that this allows for continued investment in carbon-intensive technologies, the amendments aim to promote a gradual shift towards more sustainable options in the aviation sector.
